result.execSummary:
All charges against Justin Craig Daly in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin Craig Daly is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Craig Daly

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin Craig Daly not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Justin Craig Daly.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered CASE DISMISSED for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant Justin Craig Daly not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Justin Craig Daly.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Justin Craig Daly not in court, in custody.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Court will authorize transfer of this case to Judge Childs, Br. 2 with defendant's pending felony case.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Festival Foods.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Justin Craig Daly in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Justin Craig Daly in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
